attributes.action: Create a Strategic Marine Resources Act
attributes.background:
Promote the protection of marine resources in the UK/British EEZ's
Safe guard UK fisheries within UK/British EEZ's post Brexit
Create and protect a sustainable asset for the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Under the UNCLOS each country has an EEZ and the protection of this natural resource is an important part of the members commitment.

The UK has no Strategic Fisheries Resources Act, and it does not have a Strategic Maritime Resources Act.

attributes.action: Refuse to take part in war in Syria and find a diplomatic path to peace
attributes.background: Bombing Syria will not help the situation. It will kill more civilians and ignite a conflict that could spiral out of control, causing massive devastation. We call on the government to refuse to engage in the conflict. Focus on political solutions and aiding diplomacy between the US and Russia
attributes.additional_details: A conflict in Syria between U.S. and Russian forces is not only something that we cannot afford to take part in, it's something we should do everything in our power to prevent. The potential consequences of such a conflict - a huge civilian death toll and the risk of igniting nuclear war - are things that need to be avoided at all costs. We urge the government not to take part in any military action in Syria but instead, with urgency, focus all available resources on finding political solutions and aiding diplomatic relations between the U.S. and Russian governments.

attributes.action: Create regulatory body to set the standards and ethics of AI development.
attributes.background: Working under the acronym OF-AIR - Office of AI Regulation, this organisation would utilise respected minds across areas such as Ethical Philosophy, Law and Technology to regulate the means and use of AI across technological sectors to prevent industrial monopoly or unethical development.
attributes.additional_details: From self driving cars or platooning vehicles, to corrupt algorithms manipulating politics and ultimately the ability to create robots that can 'think for themselves', what was once the realms of Science Fiction is now upon us as a reality and should be controlled to prevent corruption across both industry and individuals and to mitigate political and unlawful gain.

attributes.action: Change the law to ensure that NICE guidance outweighs the "Bolam Test"
attributes.background: I have suffered a heart attack which left me disabled. I allege this was due to sub-standard practices. However, solicitors say that my case would not meet the 'Bolam Test', in that, if a similar expert would have 'done the same thing' then a claim will fail even if NICE guidance has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Nice Guidance states that “If you currently have chest pain ... you may need to go to hospital as an emergency ... if you do not currently have chest pain and your ECG was normal … you should have an assessment in hospital on the same day" 
(Solicitor's response - below) 
".. NICE guidelines are recommendations ... advice they provide should not be compared to .. many years of professional experience".

attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Start charging for non-emergencies in A & E across the U.K
attributes.background:
There are too many people wasting Doctors time & resources in 
A & E Departments across the U.K. I think these non-emergencies should be charged for time wasting when these people could have gone to their GP or pharmacist to get sorted. The monies collected should then be put back into the system.

attributes.action: Give anyone who has a long-term health condition medication on the NHS
attributes.background:
Some people end up needing hospital treatment because they cannot afford their medication. 

Health officials say they have made sure people with chronic illnesses have access to affordable prescription but the current system is arbitrary and unfair.
attributes.additional_details: People with Diabetes have their medication and equipments on the NHS but what about people who have the leading cause of death being Heart Disease in the UK/World-wide? Conditions such as Heart Disease, Crohns or Parkinson's etc should be available on the NHS, doing this could save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: To debate the impact of not returning FULL control of our fisheries to the UK.
attributes.background: The decision to continue to allow EU fishing vessels access to UK  waters crosses political boundaries as the current EU policy is damaging our fish stocks and our fishing industry. It needs to be a Brexit negotiation red line as a plastic free ocean without fish is failure

attributes.action: Change when employers can dismiss employees without cause back to one year.
attributes.background: The qualifying period for unfair dismissal increased from one to two years in April of 2012. This made it easy for a company to dismiss someone after less than two years' employment. You could work for a company for nearly two years and be dismissed for no apparent reason.
attributes.additional_details: You have no options once this happens as the company is not obligated to reinstate you, offer another position, and neither are you entitled to compensation outside their discretion which is quite often unsatisfactory. With the current system, good employees are left with no security.

attributes.action: Fund retraining of local authority health officers at every level
attributes.background: Fully fund awareness training of local council health officers at every level to recognise their obligations to enforce prosecutions of slum rogue landlords when issuing improvement notices.Vulnerable tenants and families are placed at greater risk of exploitation by current legislation.
attributes.additional_details:
Local authories work with slum landlords by communicating direct with them instead of engaging with and involving the tenant throughout.
This process needs to be more transparent with accountability at every stage .
Private sector tenants are disenfranchised by the current legislation.
This allows slum landlords to bypass the tenants concerns and issues and communicate directly with local councils and place vulnerable tenants at risk.Council staff EHOs need more training at every level

attributes.action: Include an option to state disagreement with a petition on the petition website.
attributes.background:
Petitions of opposing viewpoints already exist on this website and some positions may gather support but still be opposed by a greater number of people. 
By including an option to "disagree with this petition" the petitions process can be simplified and made more representative of public opinion.

attributes.action: Introduce a standardised 'no added sugar' label
attributes.background: Being in the situation of needing to make lifestyle changes and cutting down on sugar, it turned out to be a lot more difficult to find food and drinks without added sugar than expected. Most processed food contains added sugar, not just the obvious sweets, cake and fizzy drinks!
attributes.additional_details: The red, amber and green food labelling has made it easier to identify healthier food and drinks but added sugar can still only be identified by going through the list of ingredients. In a time of increasing numbers of diabetes, obesity, cancer and other conditions a healthy lifestyle should be made easy. Natural sugar is still sugar but the way healthier option as it comes combined with nutrients.

attributes.action: Require Schools in England to teach & sing the National Anthem once a week
attributes.background: Only 35% of the UK are proud to be British says a recent poll, this is a giant drop from 10 years ago! Why? The UK with England at it's heart invented the most popular sports. Have legends in Music, Arts, Science, Finance.. Team GB came 2nd at the Olympics!! So let's help regrow the National pride!!
attributes.additional_details: The USA, France and many countries sing their Anthem weekly in schools. Why do we not? We have so much to be proud of. From Yorkshire Puddings to Julie Dench, Mo Farah to Harry Potter. Whether it's Music, Arts, Sports, Commerce or any other possible area England are up there and dominating. Patriotism is falling rapidly, we need to help regrow the passion and allow our children to be taught the Anthem in Schools and to be proud like they should be of the great Country which they are living in.

attributes.action: Ban diesel cars, post-Brexit
attributes.background: Diesel NOx cheating kills 23,500 UK people a year prematurely, at 10 times the USA’s gun death rate. The UK cannot wait 23 years and see 540,500 die early. We must follow the Germans and ban diesels immediately Post-Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Last July, the UK banned diesel cars by 2040, because EU diesel testing failure had worsened breaching of NOx targets. Many German cities exceed EU limits. So, last February, Germany’s highest court ruled that cities can ban the worst diesels.

Car makers and politicians move between both spheres in Germany, the major EU budget contributor. It got EU CO2 regulations to favour diesel, ignoring NOx. VW cheated on emission testing. With 3 jailed, police are investigating 3 of VW’s top people.

attributes.action: Examine viable options for nationalising Thames Water.
attributes.background: In March 2018 up to 20,000 London households suffered an unplanned interruption in their water supply.  This lasted several days and caused significant hardship and distress. It was likely due to vital infrastructure being unable to cope with adverse weather conditions due to underinvestment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jan/09/nationalise-rail-gas-water-privately-owned

https://www.theguardian.com/business/nils-pratley-on-finance/2017/nov/24/thames-water-explains-why-nationalisation-is-suddenly-popular

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2017/07/01/thames-water-bows-ofwat-pressure-chairman-heads-exit/

https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/ofwat-statement-thames-water-leakage-commitments/

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/nov/30/thames-water-ofwat-performance

attributes.action: lower to a 5% VAT  rather than 20% vet bills and costs to every pet owner
attributes.background: realising i pay more on VAT pet bills than my yearly gas and electric Bill, it's stupid yes pets are an option so I understand the cost but to most elderly a dog/pet is what they get up for every morning it's not fair for them to be paying this amount or anyone for that matter

attributes.action: Help long term borough council foster carers move home to Care for more children
attributes.background:
I am a foster carer with over 12 years experience, having looked after over 45 children. 
I believe the government could help long serving foster carers to move to a larger home so that more children have access to good levels of care.
attributes.additional_details: The average IFA placement is over 2.5 times the cost of an in house placement for a looked after child. Meaning that if I had enough room for another LAC at home I would save the government over £500000 in the next ten years. Surely some level of investment coupled with a contract for the foster carers would be a very sound investment in the long term. I am sure that every councils IFA bill far exceeds its bill for in house carers. Let's fix this problem.

attributes.action: Stop Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Bus time on bank holiday is same Sunday. Many local councils make money using bus lane on bank holiday. Their actions is not benefit to our society.

attributes.action: Fund enough specialist schooling for teenagers with mental health problems
attributes.background: Many teenagers suffer from depression, anxiety, PTSD and other mental health conditions. They can be out of school for years without any interaction with the authorities. No service has any interest in helping young people with mental health problems with supported schooling.
attributes.additional_details:
20% of adolescents may experience a mental health problem in any given year.
50% of mental health problems are established by age 14 and 75% by age 24.
10% of children and young people (aged 5-16 years) have a clinically diagnosable mental problem3, yet 70% of children and adolescents who experience mental health problems have not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. 
(Mental health Foundation)

attributes.action: More funding for a cure for patients suffering with IBD
attributes.background: The two main forms of inflammatory bowel disease are Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis. Both are chronic diseases that cause inflammation of the digestive system. As well as these intestinal problems, the disease may be associated with abnormalities of the joints, eyes, liver and skin.
attributes.additional_details: Crohn’s disease is the inflammation of the digestive system which leads to diarrhoea, abdominal pain, tiredness and weight loss. Ulcerative colitis is a lifelong disease that is associated with significant morbidity. With Ulcerative Colitis being the most common of the two most patients are diagnosed under the age of 25. Having the start of our lives filled with doctors appointments, hospital apppointments, to be used on clinical trials for drugs that can only surpress and not cure our illness.

attributes.action: Set minimum prices for milk and other dairy products
attributes.background: Supermarkets force dairy farms to sell milk at below production costs or lose contracts. So dairy farms prioritise milk yield of cattle over animal welfare leading to cruelty(e.g zero grazing, unhealthy cattle selectively bred for milk yield only). Huge amounts of unsold milk is poured down drains.
attributes.additional_details:
Milk is still cheaper than bottled water, even after recent price rises due to some dairies being driven out of business by having to sell to supermarkets at a loss, reducing supply. That's crazy.
https://food.ndtv.com/opinions/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarket-boycott-as-milk-price-falls-1204828
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/aug/06/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarkets-boycott-as-milk-price-falls
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/price-of-milk-to-go-up-after-dairy-closures-tr220h3sr

attributes.action: Require all schools to teach children about the severity of acid attacks.
attributes.background: We have recently seen increasing numbers in the amount of these life-changing acid attacks. For example, in 2012 the attack of Naomi Oni, who had acid chucked on her whilst walking through London. Since, 2012 acid attacks have doubled. It is vital that we educate children about this danger.
attributes.additional_details: Last year there were more than 450 acid attacks in London alone. Many have argued to make the sale of acids more regulated and that you should no longer to be able to 'buy it over the counter' however I do not think this is how we should tackle this problem. By further regulating the sale of acids we will not stop the problem directly, however by educating our youth on the effects of these life-changing attacks, we will hopefully see a decrease in the number of attacks in areas such as London.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools/colleges to start lessons before 10AM
attributes.background: Child sleep disorders in the uk are on the rise. More and more children are developing mental health issues and their attitude, attendance and grades are getting worse. All because of one thing. School starting early. Most schools in the uk start their lessons around 8:30 and this is way too early.

attributes.action: Revoke Independent Schools' Charitable Status
attributes.background: Over the next 5 years the public will Subsidize £522 million in tax breaks to private schools in which 7% of the wealthy few attend. This is thanks to their status as charities. We call on the government to remove charitable status,  and thus taxpayer support,  from fee-paying schools

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to have a free NHS flu jab from September 2018 onwards
attributes.background: Many people considered 'at risk' are fortunate enough to be vaccinated for free, however not everybody is. The recent outbreak has caused lots of people to suffer and even more strain on the NHS. It is counterproductive to deny the flu jab to 'healthy' people as we are not invincible and do get flu.
attributes.additional_details:
It is possible to pay to have the jab at a pharmacy, but they are not all equal. Some are better than others.

'For otherwise healthy people, flu can be very unpleasant.' - NHS Choices. They acknowledge this is the case for those deemed not to be at risk, yet still do not offer us protection. 

'The surge sparked fresh pleas from doctors for the millions of people who have not had the winter flu jab, including those at particular risk from the virus, to get immunised urgently.' - The Guardian

attributes.action: Remove Parabens,Artificial Colour,Flavour & Preservatives from Infant Medication
attributes.background: Make all pharmaceutical companies removed parabens, all artificial colours, flavours and preservatives currently found in liquid medications, primarily used by parents for young children and especially babies. Babies should definitely not be exposed to parabens in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
Parabens have been proven to adversely affect the reproductive systems in rats and have no place in childrens medications

There is evidence that parabens and para- hydroxybenzoic acid may act as oestrogenic endocrine disruptors. Source below:
http://www.breastcanceruk.org.uk/science-and-research/parabens/
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ruth-romano/parabens-and-breast-cance_b_15963020.html
They should not be contained in product given to babies i.e. immature reproductive system/pre puberty

attributes.action: Make Public Company Directors Personally Liable for Company Failures
attributes.background: In the UK we have created a corporate environment where Company Directors are rewarded for success and failure. This is different for SME owners where risk taking is offset by the potential of losing everything, including their home. We believe such rules should apply to Corporate Directors.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that there needs to be greater accountability by Public Company Directors. We believe there needs to be a change to corporate law where, to be a Company Director of a PLC (or any company on a public share exchange), individuals have to provide personal securities commensurate with the financial rewards. These securities should extend to pension provisions.
By introducing a personal element of risk to Senior Executives, irresponsible risk taking will be eliminated in our major PLCs.

attributes.action: Electrocardiogram (ECG) scans should be made compulsory for all young people.
attributes.background: Test every teenager for deadly undiagnosed heart defects that kills 12 people every week in the UK. 80% of heart defects are found through ECG scans, as there are no symptoms - meaning hundreds of lives would be saved each year. One in 500 people suffer and their hearts could stop at any point.
attributes.additional_details: Renowned cardiologist Professor Sanjay Sharma, medical director for the virgin London Marathon and Professor of Cardiology at St George's University Hospital, agrees saying: 'Each week 12 young people in the UK die suddenly from a heart condition they didn't know they had.' 'The vast majority of those - more than 80% - won't have symptoms, but the same proportion would have been picked up through a three minute ECG.'

attributes.action: Ban knives longer than 4 inches.
attributes.background:
No person needs a knife longer than 4 inches. If this law is passed then the UK will have a reduction in crime. 
Please sign the petition to make the UK a safer place.

attributes.action: Create an international phone number for UK emergency services.
attributes.background: There have been cases in the media of people attempting suicide over live streaming on social media sites or posing a danger to themselves online. These situations have been streamed internationally but people in foreign countries are not able to report these incidents in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: An international UK emergency service number, I believe, is vital and would allow for people abroad to report an incident first hand and potentially speed up the response to incidents of such a nature.

attributes.action: Include tax exempt income in child maintenance payments.
attributes.background: Child maintenance payments do not include tax-exempt income. For example, a parent who was injured in war can receive thousands of pounds per month in tax-exempt pension. Of this they would only have to pay a few pounds per week to their child.
attributes.additional_details: How is it ok that the government remove financial responsibility for children when it can clearly be afforded?

attributes.action: Make Mental health check ups free and compulsory yearly for anyone
attributes.background: Mental health is stigmatised so not enough people are getting the help they need by reaching out. So many people have died because of this. I want to make it compulsory to have a yearly mental health check up so everyone can get the support that they deserve.

attributes.action: Ban import of all Burmese products to the UK
attributes.background:
Discriminatory government policies and militry violance in Mayanmar have compelled 600,000 Rohingya's to fled their homes to Bangladesh.

Violations of human rights, including burning villages, killings, raping, torturing women & children, ethnically cleansing Burma of Rohingya population.
attributes.additional_details:
Rohingya are Muslim minority group. They differ from Myanmar’s dominant Buddhist groups ethnically, linguistically, and religiously.

The government refuses to grant the Rohingya citizenship, as a result they have no legal documentation, effectively making them stateless. Myanmar’s 1948 citizenship law was already exclusionary, and the military junta, which seized power in 1962, introduced a law twenty years later stripping the Rohingya of access to full citizenship.

attributes.action: More funding for the National Health Service and take it out of crisis
attributes.background: I have seen casualty departments where people are begging for help, I've seen where patients are being kept in corridors and I've seen nurses and doctors struggle to provide the appropriate care required when they are stretched to their limit.

attributes.action: Introduce compensation  for misleading people to buy diesel cars
attributes.background: We were told to buy diesel cars a few years ago and now we are being told to buy electric cars. If you have a diesel car you have to pay to enter into London when the government were the ones who told us to get diesel cars as they are better. I think we should get money from the government for this
attributes.additional_details: I believe we should get compensation for this as we were told to buy diesel cars and now we have to pay extra for someone's mistake

attributes.action: To be compulsory for dog owners to muzzle their dogs if using extendable lead
attributes.background: A cat on my street was sleeping on his windowsill an elderly lady came onto the street with her dog on one of these leads. The dog was at least 15ft in front of lady went between a car saw the cat and fatally attacked and killed the cat, because she didn't have full control of her animal.

attributes.action: Allow working parents free childcare ALL YEAR up to the age of 10.
attributes.background: Working a full time job and having children is hard!  Reagrdless of whether you are single or a couple. The general work place gives 23ish days holiday while children are given 11 weeks,  with no family network to rely on childcare is very costly, almost to the point of it not being worth working.
attributes.additional_details:
You feel guilty if you do work and guilty if you dont! If you want us to work and input into society, help us!
It would be easier to go on benfits and watch my children grow up. 
Help is really needed here! So many people are working just to pay for childcare not to mention how many must be left alone.
Let us have a quality of life with our children.

attributes.action: Recruit at least 20,000 more police officers.
attributes.background: There is a national crises. Volumes of emergencies have increased rapidly in the last 5 years. Speed is the key to solving crimes and there is the "golden hour" which is often missed causing loss of evidence resulting in not finding perpetrators.
attributes.additional_details: Figures obtained from the BBC Police under pressure programme on 16th May 2018. Police themselves are under threat from organised gangs who are aware of police limitations.  There have been 23,000 assaults on officers in 2014/15 alone. Not all assaults get reported. The rate of physical assault against police officers being almost 12 times the "all occupations" rate. Cracks are now beginning to show, increasing amounts of risk to public safety because there are less and less officers and staff.

attributes.action: Demand a pay cut of £13,612 of all MLAs in Northern Ireland
attributes.background: There has been deadlock in Stormont with key players obstructing negotiations since the assembly collapse. Public services are suffering due to the collapse while public servants receive full pay. This is unreasonable!
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-northern-ireland-42418944
I z http://www.itv.com/news/utv/2018-03-13/bradley-rejects-claims-of-dithering-over-mla-pay/

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park across/block a private driveway
attributes.background: It seems a large oversight that people have free will to deny people the use of their own driveways by parking across with no repercussions. I myself have had multiple incidents and I’m sure many other people have also and no legal right to get the car moved. I hope to get this changed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to have alcohol at school events in which children are present.
attributes.background: Alcohol plays far too big a part in society as it is. Alcohol is a grown up thing that children should not be part of. By having alcohol at children's school events we are not only weakening the safeguarding of the children attending, but also showing them that we drink to have a good time.
attributes.additional_details:
Adults should be leading by good example. You can't teach responsible drinking while drinking in front of them. It should be respected that there are parents that want to raise their children in alcohol free environments. 
1 in 5 children are affected by a parents drinking this also needs to be taken into consideration, for some of those children school is a safe and fun environment. 
There is no argument for alcohol at schools, other than "we want it" However there are many disadvantages to it.

attributes.action: Remove all benefit caps on Kinship/sgo carers
attributes.background: Across the country kinship carer are struggling because of benefit caps leaving most of them worse off than they would be if they never took on these children. It would cost more to keep them in care make payments to these wonderful people more inline  with foster carers or please  remove the caps.

attributes.action: Fund free travel on public transport for all students in England.
attributes.background: Students do not earn money and yet have to pay for travel. This is not fair and many cannot afford it. Students are normally travelling to school/ college and shouldn't have to pay for this. This is why we feel that all students should have free travel and we urge you to sign it.

attributes.action: Make it law that people have to vote, same as Australia
attributes.background: Make it law in the UK that people have to vote unless they have a legitimate reason not to. If they don't vote and don't have a legitimate reason then they should get fined.
attributes.additional_details: This needs to happen as the amount of people who do vote is appalling and numbers need to rise.

attributes.action: Abolish inheritance tax
attributes.background:
It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again.

attributes.action: Make a law on age for babysitting and being left home alone
attributes.background: As confusing as it is some people think it's wrong to let teenagers under 16 look after their siblings or other young children, whilst others see no harm As it can be good to trust these days and at other times there are risks..
attributes.additional_details:
Do we educate our children how to deal with emergencies when they arise or how to cook their own food without setting fire to the kitchen.
Just think a law should be in place to protect not only the children but others around and make it a legal age to babysit

attributes.action: Require all businesses who sell food to provide dairy alternatives
attributes.background: A growing number of children are being daignosed with dairy intolerance. Wouldn't it be nice to stop at your local ice cream parlour and be able to buy a dairy alternative ice cream or take your diary intolerant child out for a milkshake at any cafe without having to check with them first?
attributes.additional_details: Seems such a small thing but trying to explain to a little boy he can't have an ice cream on the seafront but the other children can is heart breaking. I believe it's about time businesses were forced to supply an alternative to dairy to meet the growing needs of intolerant children and adults.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for food products to have carbon print and water usage labels
attributes.background:
The current rate of climate change is having devastating effects on the planet with natural disasters becoming more commonplace.
Some food products are much more carbon and water intensive in production than others and having these labels will allow us to be more informed.
attributes.additional_details:
With around 10% of the UK’s carbon emissions in 2016 coming from domestic agriculture https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/679334/2016_Final_Emissions_Statistics_one_page_summary.pdf
we should consider ways in which to reduce this.

Companies like Tesco once opted to add carbon labels to some food products on a voluntary basis; however, they then dropped this policy in part due to other retailers failing to follow suit.

attributes.action: Minimum 5 year sentence for possession of Offensive Weapons in a public place.
attributes.background: The current sentencing tariffs are insufficient and ineffective as a deterrent. On first offence, a minimum sentence of 6 months custody which may be suspended for 5 years, depending on specific circumstance. On second offence, a minimum sentence of 5 years custody, with no option of early release.
attributes.additional_details:
Current CPS sentencing guidance for 16-17 year olds, is set to 4 months minimum detention and a training order, in the worst scenarios: ( https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/offensive-weapons-knives-bladed-and-pointed-articles ) Clearly, this is not a deterrent.
The proposed tariffs would apply to all ages. To ensure the new tariffs are clear, a campaign to publicise them to the target audience (10 years old and above suggested) should be conducted through National & local media.

attributes.action: Ban Mobile Phones on School Grounds
attributes.background: Our children are struggling at school. They are distracted by the thrill of social media via their mobile device. This must stop so why allow them to take the device onto school grounds?  If they have a problem at school, or we need to contact them urgently, we should go via the school office.
attributes.additional_details:
Not allowing them to take their devices to school would promote their conversational skills (they would be forced to talk to one another), allow them to focus more on their lessons, stop contact with parents during the day (we are busy with work and do not need the worry) and reduce online bullying.

It’s about time the UK Government woke up to this epidemic of device use at school and started to realise what effect it is having on the working force of tomorrow.  Let’s do something now!
